context_bundle.summary: Secrets management for credentials, API keys, certificates: Never hardcode secrets. PowerShell: SecretManagement module (local vault), Azure Key Vault (cloud). Environment variables for CI/CD. Tools: HashiCorp Vault, AWS Secrets Manager, Azure Key Vault, Google Secret Manager. Patterns: rotation (auto-rotate credentials), least privilege (minimal permissions), encryption at rest/transit. Avoid: hardcoding, committing to git, plain text logs.

onboarding.quick_start: Secrets management: PowerShell SecretManagement: Install-Module Microsoft.PowerShell.SecretManagement, Register-SecretVault, Set-Secret -Name 'APIKey' -Secret $secret, Get-Secret -Name 'APIKey' -AsPlainText. Azure Key Vault: Get-AzKeyVaultSecret -VaultName 'MyVault' -Name 'DBPassword' -AsPlainText. HashiCorp Vault: vault kv put secret/myapp api_key=xyz, vault kv get secret/myapp. Environment variables: $env:API_KEY in CI/CD, inject at runtime. Never: hardcode passwords, commit secrets to git, log secrets. Rotation: auto-rotate credentials periodically. Least privilege: grant minimal permissions. Encrypt: at rest (AES) and transit (HTTPS).
common_patterns: HashiCorp Vault: vault kv put secret/app key=value, vault kv get -field=key secret/app
AWS Secrets Manager: aws secretsmanager get-secret-value --secret-id MySecret
Clear after use: if ($secret) { Clear-Variable secret }
Rotation: automate credential rotation every 90 days
Least privilege: grant only required permissions, no admin access
Encryption: AES-256 at rest, TLS 1.2+ in transit
Never: hardcode, commit .env to git, log secrets in plain text
